message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.NE 

The paper discusses a method to improve the calibration of multiclass classifiers, which is a common problem in machine learning. The method is applicable to classifiers from any model class, making it relevant to a wide range of sub-categories. The use of neural networks is mentioned, suggesting relevance to sub-categories such as cs.LG and cs.NE. The experiments involve datasets and classifiers related to computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL), indicating relevance to those sub-categories. The paper also discusses measures such as log-loss and Brier score, which are commonly used in the evaluation of machine learning models, suggesting relevance to sub-categories such as cs.AI.
